snippet: The automaker’s chief executive says a software update will allow the Model S to navigate highways without the driver’s touching the wheel or pedals. But is it legal?
abstract: Tesla chief executive Elon Musk says maker of high-end electric cars will introduce technology in summer 2015 for its Model S sedans that would allow vehicles to drive themselves in hands-free mode; some industry experts question whether such autonomous driving is legal.
lead_paragraph: The automaker’s chief executive says a software update will allow the Model S to navigate highways without the driver’s touching the wheel or pedals. But is it legal?

headline.main: Elon Musk Says Self-Driving Tesla Cars Will Be in the U.S. by Summer
headline.print_headline: Tesla Says Its Model S Car Will Drive Itself This Summer
